annevk: how is ORB supposed to work with CORP? The pr does ORB check before CORP.
content.formatted_body: annevk: how is ORB supposed to work with CORP? The pr does ORB check before CORP.

content.body: smaug: there's some discussion about allowing CORP to bypass it at the end of https://github.com/annevk/orb/issues/3
content.formatted_body: smaug: there's some discussion about allowing CORP to bypass it at the end of https://github.com/annevk/orb/issues/3

content.body: aha
just noticed that some requests Google docs does are blocked by ORB because of this
smaug: interesting, how would they have been able to use these responses? The CORP thing was mainly considered for future formats
content.formatted_body: smaug: interesting, how would they have been able to use these responses? The CORP thing was mainly considered for future formats

content.body: oh, hmm, is this a beacon
smaug: ah okay, for those the response is ignorable anyway, could even decide to not let the website process know about those and save some CPU cost
content.formatted_body: smaug: ah okay, for those the response is ignorable anyway, could even decide to not let the website process know about those and save some CPU cost

content.body: yeah
GMaps has some 204 responses, also with cross-origin-resource-policy: cross-origin, and those "fail" because or ORB
smaug: that might be a real problem; I guess we need to safelist 204
content.formatted_body: smaug: that might be a real problem; I guess we need to safelist 204

content.body: smaug: I wonder if we should still try to validate something about the body, perhaps that it doesn't have one
content.formatted_body: smaug: I wonder if we should still try to validate something about the body, perhaps that it doesn't have one
